Type_2:
The 19 year - old added 85 for the first wicket with Paul Horton ( 41 ) before Glamorgan claimed three quick wickets , two to teenager Lukas Carey . Dearden then dominated a stand of 90 with Mark Pettini ( 63 not out ) before being bowled by spinner Andrew Salter . Pettini steered the Foxes to a second batting point underneath the lights . Dearden , who was dropped on one , survived a couple of run - out chances in his lengthy vigil of 145 runs, an innings that anchored Leicestershire's first innings and set a challenging total for Glamorgan. His century, a testament to his resilience and growing maturity, included 18 fours and two sixes, played across more than five hours at the crease. It was an innings of two halves, patiently accumulating runs against the new ball before accelerating with Mark Pettini in a partnership that put the visitors on the back foot. The early scares, being dropped and almost run out, only seemed to steel his resolve, as he focused on building a substantial total for his team. His dismissal by Andrew Salter, a rare lapse in concentration, came from a ball that spun sharply back into him, ending a truly memorable individual performance.

With Dearden gone, Leicestershire still needed to consolidate. Mark Pettini, who had played an excellent supporting role, then took on the mantle of primary aggressor. He found an able partner in Ned Eckersley, and the pair continued to build on the platform Dearden had established. Glamorgan, despite their earlier breakthroughs, found it difficult to dislodge Pettini, whose experience shone through. Lukas Carey, though expensive in patches, continued to pose a threat with his pace and bounce, while Andrew Salter tried to tie down the scoring with his accurate left-arm spin. The Welsh county's bowlers, however, struggled to maintain consistent pressure as the pitch flattened out under the floodlights.

Pettini reached his own well-deserved hundred just before the close of play, guiding Leicestershire past the 400-run mark. They declared their innings at 415 for 7, giving their bowlers a brief spell at Glamorgan's openers before stumps. The declaration was a clear statement of intent, aiming to put Glamorgan under pressure immediately. Glamorgan faced a tricky 10-over period under lights, which proved challenging. Sam Northeast and Nick Selman weathered the initial storm, but the Foxes' new ball bowlers, led by Chris Wright, made them play at everything. Glamorgan ended the day on 28 for 1, having lost Selman cheaply, caught at slip off a superb delivery from Gavin Griffiths. Northeast (15 not out) and Marnus Labuschagne (8 not out) will resume tomorrow, with Glamorgan still trailing by a substantial 387 runs. The match remains finely poised, with Leicestershire holding a clear advantage due to Dearden's heroics and Pettini's late flourish, but Glamorgan will be hoping their strong batting line-up can respond on what appears to be a good batting surface. The early wickets on day two will be crucial for both sides as the contest heats up in this Championship clash.

It 's reported he had the idea at 2 pm and after a whirl of speculation , and a few changes of venue , tickets went on sale for Koko in Camden at 7 pm . Crowds waited hours in the cold before Kanye eventually took to the stage about 1.20am . The anticipation was palpable, a testament to the artist's magnetic pull, even amidst the late hour and biting chill. When the lights dimmed and the first notes rang out, a collective roar erupted from the packed Koko, transforming the long wait into a forgotten inconvenience. Kanye, known for his electrifying, often unpredictable, live shows, launched into a powerful set, blending tracks from his expansive discography with new material. The energy was electric, a raw connection between the artist and his dedicated fanbase.

The night, however, held even more surprises for the Camden crowd. Mid-set, the atmosphere intensified as London's grime royalty emerged. First, the iconic Skepta exploded onto the stage, sending the venue into a frenzy with a blistering performance, solidifying the long-rumored collaboration. The crowd was already in raptures when JME joined his brother, delivering a high-octane display that further elevated the sky-high energy. The sight of these titans sharing the stage was pure magic, a cultural convergence. Adding to the international flavour, Vic Mensa, a close collaborator of Kanyes, also made a surprise appearance, showcasing his distinct flow. The mix of long-time fans and eager newcomers savoured every second of the historic, unconventional concert. It was a chaotic, brilliant night that cemented Kanye's reputation for pushing boundaries and delivering unforgettable experiences, leaving an indelible mark on London's music scene and the fervent crowd who braved the elements for a truly special performance.

It was the first time the Commonwealth gold medallist had fought in front of his home crowd at a packed Meadowbank . " I did n't think it would be as quick as that , " Taylor told BBC Scotland . " This boy is very special , " said manager Barry McGuigan . We 've got to take the right fights at the right time . " The Hungarian Mate came into the contest with an impressive record with 17 wins in his 22 previous fights , but it was evident from the first bell that Mate was in for a tough night. Taylor, known for his explosive power and intelligent boxing, wasted no time in asserting his dominance. He moved fluidly, cutting off the ring and landing sharp, accurate jabs that quickly reddened Mates face. The Edinburgh crowd, already buzzing with anticipation, roared with every connection. Taylors southpaw stance and powerful left hand proved particularly problematic for the Hungarian, who struggled to find his rhythm or land anything significant in return.

Within the first minute, a blistering combination from Taylor  a left hook followed by a straight right  sent Mate stumbling backward into the ropes. The Commonwealth gold medallist, sensing an early finish, pressed home his advantage with relentless aggression. Mate showed commendable resilience, trying to clinch and weather the storm, but Taylor's precision and volume of punches were overwhelming. Just past the midway point of the opening round, a perfectly timed left uppercut from Taylor snapped Mates head back, followed by a crunching right hook that sent the visitor to the canvas.

The referee immediately began his count as Mate struggled to regain his footing, his eyes glazed. Although he managed to clamber upright at the count of nine, his legs were clearly unsteady, and the referee wisely waved off the contest, deeming him unable to continue. The official time of the stoppage was just 2 minutes and 10 seconds of the first round, a truly emphatic and devastating performance from the Prestonpans pugilist. The packed Meadowbank Arena erupted in a deafening roar, a standing ovation for their hometown hero.

After the fight, a beaming Taylor soaked in the adulation of the crowd, acknowledging their support. Speaking to BBC Scotland later, he reflected on the win, reiterating his surprise at the swiftness of the victory. "I came here expecting a tough fight, maybe a few rounds to get warmed up, but I caught him clean early and just went for it. The support from the fans was incredible, it really spurred me on."

Manager Barry McGuigan, the legendary former world champion, watched on with immense satisfaction. "Josh showed tonight exactly why we believe he's destined for greatness," McGuigan told reporters. "His power, his speed, his ring intelligence  it's all there. He handled the pressure of fighting at Meadowbank in front of his home fans perfectly. This was a statement win, a clear message to the super-lightweight division. We're not rushing anything, as I said before, we've got to take the right fights at the right time to develop him properly. But he's learning and improving with every bout. We'll sit down, review this performance, and plan the next step. There are big fights out there for Josh, and hes ready for the challenges that lie ahead. This performance only confirms that he is truly a very special talent, someone who could go all the way to the top of the sport." The victory marked another significant milestone in Taylor's rapidly ascending professional career, setting the stage for even bigger challenges and proving his pedigree on home soil against a credible opponent, even if the fight itself didn't last long. The buzz around Taylor grew exponentially after this dominant display at Meadowbank, solidifying his status as one of Scotland's most exciting boxing prospects, a true champion in the making, following in the footsteps of previous Commonwealth Games successes.

Type_2:
The Belgian , 24 , who signed from Everton for 75 m , got the winner seven minutes before half - time to add to Henrikh Mkhitaryan 's equaliser after United had fallen behind on 20 minutes . United then lost Juan Mata to injury and Antonio Valencia to a red card . " [ Lukaku 's goal ] is nice for him but not important for me , " said Mourinho . " I told him that what's important is the collective result, the three points, not his personal tally. His goal was crucial, yes, but it came in a game where we faced significant challenges, including going behind, losing Juan Mata to injury, and Antonio Valencia to a red card. These moments test a team's resilience, and I'm pleased with how we fought to get the win, but we must learn from the mistakes that put us in those difficult positions. The injury to Juan Mata is a big concern. He is a key player for us, and his creativity will be missed. We will assess the extent of the injury, but it did not look good. As for Antonio Valencia's red card, it was a moment of indiscipline that he knows was unnecessary. An experienced player should not make such a mistake, leaving his team with ten men and missing the next match. We cannot afford these kinds of errors if we want to compete for major honours.

Romelu knows my expectations are high, not just for scoring goals, but for his all-round contribution. I want to see him link up play, press from the front, and be constantly involved in our attacking build-up, not just waiting for chances. Goals are a consequence of doing everything else correctly. He has the potential to be a complete forward for Manchester United, and we will continue to work on all aspects of his game. The team showed character to get the win after so many setbacks, including Henrikh Mkhitaryan's equaliser being cancelled out earlier before we recovered. However, the overall performance was not perfect. We gave them too much space at times and should have been more clinical to finish the game off sooner. We must improve consistently. We take the three points, analyse where we need to get better, and immediately focus on the next challenge. The season is long, and we need every player to maintain focus, discipline, and deliver high-level performances without errors that hurt the team.
Type_5_1st:
Romelu Lukaku, the 24-year-old Belgian striker, a 75 million signing from Everton, secured the winning goal seven minutes before the half-time whistle. This came after Henrikh Mkhitaryan had previously equalised, following United falling behind just 20 minutes into the match. The team then suffered further difficulties with Juan Mata's injury and Antonio Valencia's sending off.

Regarding Lukaku's decisive strike, Mourinho commented, "It's pleasing for him personally, but for me, it holds less significance." He reiterated, "I conveyed to him that the crucial aspect is the team's collective achievement, securing the three points, not his individual goal count. While his goal was indeed vital, it was scored in a game marked by considerable adversities, including conceding first, Mata's injury, and Valencia's red card. Such moments truly test a team's resilience, and I'm satisfied with our fighting spirit to clinch the victory, though we must learn from the mistakes that led to these challenging situations."

Mata's injury is a major concern. "He is an essential player for us, and his creative influence will be sorely missed. We will ascertain the full extent of the injury, but it appeared serious," Mourinho stated. Addressing Valencia's red card, he described it as an "unnecessary act of indiscipline which he acknowledges. An experienced player should avoid such an error, leaving his side with ten men and missing the subsequent fixture. We cannot afford these kinds of lapses if we aim to contend for significant honours."

"Romelu understands my high expectations, which extend beyond merely scoring goals to encompass his entire contribution," Mourinho continued. "I expect him to engage in link-up play, press defenders from the front, and be constantly involved in our attacking build-up, rather than simply waiting for scoring opportunities. Goals are a natural outcome of executing all other aspects correctly. He possesses the potential to develop into a complete forward for Manchester United, and we will persist in refining every facet of his game."

The team demonstrated remarkable character to secure the win despite numerous setbacks, including the initial deficit. "However, the overall performance wasn't flawless," Mourinho noted. "We allowed them excessive space at times and needed to be more clinical to settle the game sooner. We must show consistent improvement. We'll take the three points, meticulously analyse areas for betterment, and immediately shift our focus to the upcoming fixture. With a protracted season ahead, every player must sustain concentration, uphold discipline, and consistently produce top-tier performances devoid of detrimental mistakes."
Type_5_3rd:
Belgian striker Romelu Lukaku, a recent 75 million acquisition from Everton, proved decisive for Manchester United, scoring the go-ahead goal just seven minutes before halftime. This followed an early setback where United had conceded within the first 20 minutes, though Henrikh Mkhitaryan quickly leveled the score. The team's challenges extended beyond the pitch, as they also contended with an injury to Juan Mata and Antonio Valencia's sending off.

Regarding Lukaku's pivotal strike, manager Jose Mourinho conveyed that while it offered personal satisfaction for the player, its individual significance was secondary to him. He explained, "My message to him was that the team's collective triumph and securing the three points are paramount, not his individual goal tally." Mourinho recognized the goal's importance but highlighted its occurrence amidst a particularly trying match, marked by conceding an early goal, Mata's injury, and Valencia's red card. He stressed that such demanding circumstances truly test a squad's spirit and was pleased with their resolve to clinch victory, yet he emphasized the necessity of learning from the mistakes that led to these predicaments.

Mata's injury posed a serious concern for the manager. Mourinho declared him "a crucial contributor to our squad, and his creative input will be sorely missed. We await the full diagnosis, but it appeared severe." Commenting on Valencia's dismissal, he characterized it as "an avoidable act of poor discipline, which Valencia himself acknowledges." Mourinho insisted that a seasoned professional must avoid such errors, especially those that leave the team disadvantaged and result in a suspension for the subsequent game. He added that such missteps are unacceptable for a team aspiring to major honors.

Mourinho further elaborated that "Romelu fully understands my high expectations, which go beyond merely scoring and encompass his overall contribution." He clarified his anticipation for Lukaku to actively participate in link-up play, apply pressure on opposition defenders, and consistently engage in the team's attacking build-up, rather than merely waiting for opportunities to shoot. According to Mourinho, goals naturally arise from successfully executing these broader responsibilities. He believes Lukaku possesses the potential to develop into a truly all-around forward for Manchester United, and the club intends to refine every aspect of his game.

Despite overcoming several adversities, including falling behind early, the team demonstrated commendable character to secure the win. However, Mourinho cautioned, "Our overall performance was not flawless. We occasionally allowed our opponents too much space and should have been more clinical to seal the game sooner. Continuous improvement is vital." He concluded by stating, "We will gladly take the three points, meticulously analyze areas for enhancement, and immediately shift our focus to the next fixture. With a long season stretching ahead, every player must maintain concentration, uphold discipline, and consistently deliver top-tier performances, free from costly errors."

Type_2:
The Rhodesian Squadron Royal Air Force plane , based at RAF Wittering , crashed at Holme on 22 November 1940 . Pilot Officer Harold Penketh , from Brighton , did not bail out and died . The Spitfire remains were found after a geophysical survey of the area . It is hoped the recovered parts will be put on public display , offering a poignant reminder of the sacrifices made during World War Two.

Pilot Officer Penketh, aged just 20 at the time of the tragedy, was flying a Supermarine Spitfire Mk IIa, a crucial fighter aircraft during the Battle of Britain and its aftermath. While the exact cause of the crash remains unknown, it is speculated that he may have been attempting to steer his damaged aircraft away from the village of Holme, thus preventing further casualties on the ground, a common act of heroism among pilots of that era. His decision not to bail out, despite the clear danger, underscores the immense courage displayed by so many young men in the face of conflict. Harold Penketh's name is commemorated on the Brighton & Hove War Memorial, serving as a permanent tribute to his ultimate sacrifice.

The archaeological team, working closely with aviation historians and military experts, undertook a meticulous excavation following the successful geophysical survey. This state-of-the-art technique had revealed anomalies beneath the surface, consistent with buried metallic objects, leading them directly to the crash site. Over several weeks, a variety of artefacts were carefully unearthed, including fragments of the Spitfire's engine, sections of the fuselage, instrumentation, and personal effects believed to belong to Pilot Officer Penketh. Each piece recovered tells a part of the story, shedding light on the intensity of aerial combat and the grim reality faced by those defending the nation's skies.

The ongoing conservation efforts aim to stabilise and preserve these precious relics. Plans are underway to create an exhibit, potentially at a local museum or a dedicated aviation heritage centre, which will not only showcase the recovered Spitfire components but also tell the personal story of Harold Penketh and the wider context of the Rhodesian Squadron Royal Air Force's operations from RAF Wittering during the war. This display will serve as an educational resource, ensuring that the bravery of individuals like Penketh and the vital role of the Spitfire in Britain's defence are never forgotten. It will allow visitors to connect directly with a piece of history, understanding the profound human cost of freedom and the legacy of the young pilots who flew from bases like RAF Wittering. The community of Brighton, in particular, has expressed a deep interest in honouring one of their own through this significant historical recovery and memorial. The ultimate goal is to provide a fitting and lasting tribute to Pilot Officer Harold Penketh and all who served.

Type_2: Kathryn Trussler 's sculptures are fashioned from consumer waste including artificial turf and polystyrene . Her exhibition , at Elysium Gallery from 19 May , to 17 June 2023, showcases Ms Trussler's unique ability to transform discarded materials into thought-provoking art. Her work often highlights environmental concerns, challenging viewers to reconsider their consumption habits and the lifecycle of everyday objects. This solo exhibition in Swansea will feature several new pieces, reinforcing Trussler's distinctive artistic voice and contributing to the city's vibrant art scene.

Type_2:
Rehtaeh Parsons , 17 , of Nova Scotia , killed herself in April after being taunted over a photo of her alleged rape by four boys , her mother has said . Two 18 - year - old men were arrested on Thursday in connection with the photograph . The men , who have not been named , will be prosecuted in a juvenile court . " We hope that today 's arrests help the community to heal , " Royal Canadian Mounted Police ( RCMP ) Superintendent Roland Wells said at a press conference in Halifax on Thursday.

Superintendent Wells, who leads the Nova Scotia RCMP's support services, emphasized that the investigation is active and ongoing, urging anyone with further information to come forward. He thanked the public for their patience and assistance throughout the complex review process. The arrests mark a significant development in a case that has drawn national and international attention, sparking widespread outrage and a critical examination of Canada's laws regarding cyberbullying and the sharing of non-consensual intimate images.

The decision to make arrests followed an intensive re-examination of the case by the RCMP, initiated after the initial investigation by Halifax Regional Police had concluded without charges in February. This earlier outcome had been met with widespread condemnation from Rehtaeh's family, victim advocates, and the public, leading to a direct appeal to the Nova Scotia government for intervention. Premier Darrell Dexter had personally apologized to Rehtaehs mother, Leah Parsons, for the handling of the case and formally requested the RCMP to take over the investigation.

Leah Parsons has been a relentless advocate for justice for her daughter, using social media and media interviews to share Rehtaehs story and highlight the devastating consequences of online harassment. She has consistently called for stronger legal measures and a more compassionate approach from law enforcement and the justice system towards victims of sexual assault. Rehtaeh's story quickly became a symbol of the urgent need for action against online violence, triggering a national debate on consent, privacy, and the responsibilities of internet users and service providers.

The two individuals arrested face charges related to the distribution of an intimate image, which allegedly depicted Rehtaeh's sexual assault. Due to their age at the time of the alleged offense and the specifics of the Youth Criminal Justice Act, their names cannot be publicly disclosed. The prosecution in a juvenile court underscores the complexities of applying existing laws to new forms of digital crime.

The community in Nova Scotia, particularly in Halifax, has been deeply affected by Rehtaehs death, with numerous vigils, protests, and online campaigns demanding justice and systemic change. While the arrests bring a sense of relief to many, including Rehtaeh's family, the broader conversation about cyberbullying and supporting victims of sexual violence continues. The RCMPs commitment to this ongoing investigation aims to provide closure for the family and reinforce that such acts will be pursued vigorously by law enforcement. This case has served as a stark reminder of the digital age's darker side and the collective responsibility to create a safer online environment.

Type_2:
PwC 's annual survey shows that just 37 % think the economy will improve in 2015 , down from 44 % last year . Perhaps unsurprisingly , Russia 's bosses have gone from the most confident to the least , due to problems caused by sanctions and the falling oil price . In the UK , concern had risen sharply about the availability of talent . The number of chief executives concerned about the availability of key skills had risen sharply. This growing talent crunch in the UK, as revealed by the PwC survey, is seen as a significant threat to growth and competitiveness. Many UK businesses report struggling to find and retain staff with essential digital and technical competencies, leading to increased investment in upskilling existing workforces and a focus on attracting international talent where possible.

In contrast to the UK's talent focus, business leaders in Germany and France voiced different primary concerns. German CEOs, while relatively more optimistic than their French counterparts, were predominantly worried about global demand slowdowns and geopolitical instability impacting their export-heavy industries. The eurozone's tepid recovery also cast a shadow, with concerns over deflation and consumer spending remaining high. In France, chief executives were more preoccupied with domestic regulatory burdens and the need for structural reforms to stimulate economic activity. Confidence levels remained subdued across both nations, reflecting a cautious European outlook amidst ongoing economic uncertainties and the lingering effects of the debt crisis.

Globally, the PwC survey of over 1,300 CEOs highlighted a universal shift towards caution. Beyond Russia's unique challenges stemming from sanctions and falling oil prices, and the UK's specific talent woes, the overall sentiment was one of strategic retrenchment. Only 37% of chief executives globally expected economic improvement, down from 44%. This marked decline underscores a pervasive sense of uncertainty across various regions, influenced by factors ranging from commodity price volatility to geopolitical tensions. CEOs indicated a greater focus on operational efficiency, cost control, and organic growth strategies, with less appetite for aggressive expansion. Investment in innovation, particularly digital technologies, emerged as a key priority to build resilience and secure competitive advantage in a volatile global market.

Type_2:
Six policemen died in a gunfight during an operation to evict the farmers from land they had been occupying . Eleven protesters were also killed . The deaths deepened political tensions in Paraguay and were used by congress to oust the left - wing President Fernando Lugo . Four men received sentences of between 18 and 30 years in jail This tragic incident, which unfolded on June 15, 2012, at the Campos Morumbi estate in Curuguaty, became widely known as the Curuguaty Massacre. The land in question was fiercely disputed, with landless farmers claiming it as state property intended for agrarian reform. The subsequent judicial process was highly controversial; human rights organizations and international observers heavily criticized the trial of the eleven farmers, alleging a lack of due process and insufficient evidence linking them to the police deaths.

The massacre provided the immediate catalyst for the Paraguayan congress to orchestrate a rapid impeachment of President Fernando Lugo. His swift removal, days after the killings, was seen as a politically motivated move to reverse his land reform agenda. Several regional governments, including MERCOSUR and UNASUR, condemned Lugo's ouster as a 'parliamentary coup,' leading to Paraguay's temporary suspension from these blocs.

Despite the initial convictions handed down in 2016, a major turning point occurred in July 2017. The Supreme Court of Justice of Paraguay annulled the sentences against the eleven convicted farmers, including the four, citing a lack of concrete evidence and procedural errors. This landmark decision led to their immediate release, marking a complex legal saga that underscored the deep-seated land conflicts and political polarization in Paraguay. The Curuguaty case remains a poignant symbol of the ongoing struggle for land rights and justice in the nation's history.
Type_5_1st:
On June 15, 2012, at the Campos Morumbi estate in Curuguaty, a violent clash during an operation to remove farmers from disputed land resulted in the deaths of six police officers and eleven protesters. This tragic event, widely termed the Curuguaty Massacre, involved landless farmers who asserted the estate was state property designated for agrarian reform. While four men were initially sentenced to lengthy prison terms ranging from 18 to 30 years, the subsequent legal proceedings faced intense scrutiny. Human rights organizations and international observers sharply criticized the trials of the eleven farmers, alleging deficiencies in due process and insufficient evidence connecting them to the police fatalities.

The massacre quickly escalated political tensions in Paraguay and served as the direct justification for the Paraguayan congress to swiftly impeach the then-President Fernando Lugo, a left-wing leader. His removal, mere days after the killings, was widely perceived as a politically motivated maneuver aimed at dismantling his land reform initiatives. Consequently, several regional bodies, including MERCOSUR and UNASUR, denounced Lugo's unseating as a 'parliamentary coup,' leading to Paraguay's temporary suspension from these blocs.

Despite convictions being issued in 2016, a pivotal development occurred in July 2017 when Paraguay's Supreme Court of Justice overturned the sentences against the eleven farmers, including the four previously mentioned. Citing a lack of concrete evidence and significant procedural errors, this landmark ruling led to their immediate liberation. The Curuguaty case thus embodies a complex legal narrative that highlights Paraguay's deep-rooted land disputes and political divisions, remaining a potent symbol in the country's ongoing quest for land rights and justice.
Type_5_3rd:
On June 15, 2012, a lethal clash erupted at the Campos Morumbi estate in Curuguaty, Paraguay, during an attempt to evict farmers occupying disputed territory. This incident, commonly known as the Curuguaty Massacre, led to the deaths of six police officers and eleven protestors. The landless farmers asserted the land belonged to the state and was designated for agrarian reform. While four individuals initially received severe prison terms, ranging from 18 to 30 years, the subsequent judicial proceedings faced widespread condemnation. Human rights organizations and international observers pointed out significant due process violations and insufficient evidence to link the accused farmers to the police fatalities during the trials of the eleven individuals.

The massacre quickly ignited political unrest across Paraguay and served as the direct justification for the rapid impeachment of then-President Fernando Lugo, a left-leaning leader, by the national congress. His removal, occurring merely days after the killings, was largely seen as a politically motivated maneuver to undermine his initiatives for land reform. Consequently, regional alliances like MERCOSUR and UNASUR denounced Lugo's dismissal as an 'institutional coup,' leading to Paraguay's temporary suspension from these organizations.

Despite convictions being issued in 2016, a pivotal moment arrived in July 2017 when Paraguay's Supreme Court of Justice invalidated the sentences against all eleven farmers, including those previously mentioned. Citing a lack of robust evidence and significant procedural flaws, this momentous decision resulted in their immediate freedom. The Curuguaty affair thus represents an intricate legal journey, highlighting Paraguay's deep-seated land conflicts and political divisions, and remains a potent symbol in the nation's ongoing pursuit of equitable land access.

Type_2: The 23 - year - old left the field during the first half of the Dragons ' defeat by Ospreys on New Year 's Day . " Dorian has had a pectoral injury , which looks quite serious , " said Dragons director of rugby Lyn Jones . " It could be a significant period out for him, which is a real blow for us, especially given the crucial stage of the season we're entering," explained Jones, his voice tinged with concern after the disappointing result against their Welsh rivals. "Dorian is a key figure in our squad, both on the field with his work rate and leadership, and off it with his presence in the changing room. Losing him on New Year's Day, particularly in a derby match that was already slipping away from us, adds to the challenge we face." The Dragons had hoped to start the new year on a positive note, but the Ospreys, marshalled superbly by the likes of Dan Biggar, proved too strong, asserting their dominance early on. This injury, coupled with other recent setbacks, highlights the depth issues Lyn Jones's side is grappling with. "We've got to assess the full extent of the damage over the next few days, but the initial signs are worrying," Jones continued. "We'll need other players to step up and fill that void. We've seen good performances from individuals, but we need that collective consistency. Players like Sarel Pretorius, who has been instrumental for us, will be even more vital in maintaining our attacking threat and composure. It's a test of our resilience, but we've faced adversity before and we'll bounce back. Our focus now shifts to getting Dorian the best possible recovery and preparing the rest of the squad for the challenges ahead, ensuring we finish the season strongly despite this significant setback.

Type_2:
The Official Charts Company says it is the first time in history an artist has taken the top two chart positions with brand new songs . The singer said he was " incredibly chuffed " by the success . " Both tracks mean a huge amount to me so it really is amazing to see them go to the top of the chart together . " Source : Official Charts Company Sheeran 's comeback follows a " gap year " where he removed himself from social media and touring to travel the world and "see more than the inside of a studio or a hotel room ". His decision to step away from the limelight, though temporary, allowed him to reconnect with his roots and find fresh inspiration, a move that has clearly paid dividends with this unprecedented chart dominance. The Official Charts Company confirmed that this double-top entry is a truly historic moment, reflecting the immense anticipation for new material from the globally adored singer-songwriter.

The two tracks, 'Shape of You' and 'Castle on the Hill', showcase different facets of Sheeran's musical artistry. 'Shape of You' is a catchy, rhythmic pop offering with a subtle dance influence, while 'Castle on the Hill' is a nostalgic, anthemic ode to his upbringing in Framlingham, Suffolk, capturing the essence of small-town life and youthful friendships. The contrasting styles demonstrate his versatility and broad appeal, ensuring both critical acclaim and commercial success. The immediate impact of both songs highlights the power of a well-executed comeback.

This phenomenal achievement comes amidst a highly competitive music landscape. While other artists like Drake have consistently dominated the charts in recent years with their own string of hits, Sheeran's simultaneous one-two punch is a unique feat that underscores his singular talent and dedicated fanbase. His return has undoubtedly revitalised the UK charts, bringing a fresh wave of excitement and setting a new benchmark for chart performance.

Upon hearing the news, Sheeran reiterated his gratitude to fans, acknowledging the hard work and personal significance behind both tracks. "It's been a long time coming," he remarked, referring to the creative process during his sabbatical. "To have both songs resonate so deeply with people, especially 'Castle on the Hill' which is so personal, means the world to me." The Official Charts Company added that the sheer volume of streams and downloads for both tracks was staggering, easily surpassing all other entries. This unparalleled success solidifies Sheeran's position as one of the most influential and popular musicians of his generation, proving that a hiatus can sometimes be the perfect catalyst for even greater triumphs. His ability to connect with listeners on such an intimate level, coupled with his undeniable songwriting prowess, continues to set him apart in the global music scene. Fans eagerly await further announcements regarding his forthcoming album, which is now poised to become one of the biggest releases of the year. The initial reception to these two singles suggests that his "gap year" has only amplified his creative output, leading to an even more refined and impactful sound. The music world is watching closely as Sheeran continues to break new ground and redefine chart history, demonstrating an enduring appeal that transcends genres and generations.

However, the return of creative spark Michael Gardyne and midfield anchor Martin Woods will provide a significant boost for Ross County as they look to bounce back from recent results. Gardynes pace and trickery on the wing, combined with Woods composure and tackling in the middle of the park, are crucial elements that were sorely missed against Rangers. McIntyre will be keen to integrate them back into the starting XI smoothly, especially as the team faces a challenging period of fixtures. The manager has repeatedly emphasized the importance of squad depth, and these fluctuating injury reports highlight the challenges faced by clubs in the Scottish Premiership. Despite the setbacks, the Dingwall side remains optimistic about their ability to compete, relying on the collective effort and the quality of those available. They will need to draw on all their resources to navigate the upcoming games, with every player expected to step up and contribute. The blend of returning experience and the challenge for younger players or fringe members to seize their opportunity will define Ross County's immediate future. The focus will be on maintaining discipline and exploiting the attacking options now available with Gardyne and Woods back in contention, aiming to climb the league table.

Type_2:
From Winston Churchill 's infamous visit to Belfast in 1912 to a 1963 Viking invasion re - enactment in a County Down fishing town , as well as tales of tourism , industrial heritage and sport , a dazzling mosaic of Ulster life is pieced together in unseen archive footage . Hundreds of unique films have been released to the public to view online for free after the British Film Institute ( BFI ) unlocked its archive as part of a major history project , From Britain On Film . Royal visits and Lord Mayor 's shows Royal visits and Lord Mayor's shows provide a glimpse into the formal public life of the region, charting the pomp and ceremony throughout the decades. Yet, the newly accessible collection delves far deeper, offering a profound window into the fabric of Ulster society. Beyond grand parades and political figures, viewers can witness the hustle and bustle of Belfast docks, the meticulous craft of linen workers, and the vibrant atmosphere of street markets. The everyday lives of ordinary people come to the fore, showing children playing, families enjoying seaside holidays, and communities gathering for local festivals.

This extraordinary collection, curated by the British Film Institute (BFI), spans over a century, chronicling moments of national significance, local customs, industrial shifts, and societal transformations. Footage ranges from early silent films of horse-drawn trams in city centres to post-war documentaries showcasing agricultural innovations in County Armagh, or the burgeoning tourism along the Antrim Coast. The films offer a living history of the province, illuminating the impact of major events and everyday life, showing a society in flux, adapting to industrialisation and evolving social norms.

Viewers can trace the evolution of industries, from ship-building in Belfast to intricate lacemaking. The development of infrastructure, towns, and rural life are all documented. Sporting events, from local GAA matches to international rugby, are featured, celebrating Ulster's sporting culture. These films are more than historical records; they are poignant time capsules, revealing the aspirations, struggles, and joys of past generations.

By making these hundreds of unique films available online, the British Film Institute (BFI) has preserved a vital part of the UKs cinematic heritage and created an invaluable resource for historians, researchers, and anyone interested in Ulster life. This project truly brings to life a dazzling mosaic of experiences, offering unparalleled insights into a region often defined by its political narrative, but here presented through diverse lives and landscapes. From the serious to the whimsical, public spectacle to quiet routine, this archive invites us to explore the many facets of Ulsters past, creating a comprehensive and deeply human record. The inclusion of early footage, such as Winston Churchill's 1912 Belfast visit, serves as a powerful reminder of how long film has documented significant moments in the region's history, contributing to this unparalleled visual compendium.

Type_2:
North Ronaldsay Primary School 's single classroom will be kept on standby from August as Teigan Scott , 12 , moves to secondary in Kirkwall . Orkney 's most northerly island only has a population of about 50 people . Orkney Islands Council said the school would be brought back into use if more families with young children moved to the island . The building is also used by community groups . Island residents have blamed poor transport links for the lack of young families . Teigan told the BBC she was "sad to leave North Ronaldsay Primary School but incredibly excited for the new opportunities and challenges awaiting her at secondary school in Kirkwall." She spoke warmly of her time at the tiny school, highlighting the unique experience of having her teacher's undivided attention and the deep bonds formed within the island's close-knit community. "It's been amazing growing up here," she said, "everyone looks out for each other. But I'm also ready for the next chapter and meeting lots of new people from different places."

Teigan's departure brings into sharp focus the precarious future of communities on Scotland's most remote islands. With no other primary-aged children currently residing on North Ronaldsay, the temporary closure of its school marks a significant moment for the island's approximately 50 inhabitants. The school is not merely an educational establishment; it serves as a vital social hub, hosting everything from community meetings and exercise classes to social events, making its educational dormancy a keenly felt loss. Its active presence has long been seen as a beacon for the island's long-term viability, signalling the potential for new families to settle.

Orkney Islands Council, while acknowledging the emotional aspect of the decision, emphasized that the standby arrangement was a pragmatic, fiscally responsible step in response to demographic realities. A spokesperson stated, "While it's always regrettable when a school ceases to have pupils attending, this allows us to maintain the building and its resources, ready to welcome pupils back as soon as the need arises. We remain committed to supporting all our island communities and actively exploring ways to encourage families to consider the unique lifestyle offered by places like North Ronaldsay." This situation reflects a wider pattern of rural depopulation across the Scottish islands, where factors like declining birth rates, an ageing population, and limited economic opportunities combine to create significant challenges for local authorities trying to sustain essential services.

The island residents' concerns about poor transport links frequently surface in discussions about attracting younger families. The infrequency and cost of ferry travel to mainland Orkney and Kirkwall are significant barriers, making access to employment, secondary education, and specialist services challenging. This isolation, while part of the island's unique appeal, can also deter those contemplating a permanent move with children. Despite these formidable hurdles, the spirit of North Ronaldsay remains resilient. Community initiatives and a deep connection to the island's heritage continue, with many hoping that strategic investments in digital connectivity and more affordable, regular transport might yet tip the balance. The ambition is to one day hear the joyous sounds of children's play once again echoing from North Ronaldsay Primary School, signalling a new chapter for this remote but determined community.

Type_2:
Ninety - three of the retailer 's 125 stores will close , with the rest remaining open while buyers are sought . If administrator KPMG can not find buyers , the remaining stores will also shut . The chain employed 1,658 people . The chain was sold to Greybull Capital last year by supermarket Morrisons , which has said it would offer jobs to ex - My Local staff . It has struggled since being acquired by private equity firm Greybull Capital in September 2015. The chain, formerly Morrisons M Local, was sold off by the supermarket giant as part of a strategic shift away from smaller convenience formats to focus on its larger superstores. At the time of the sale, Morrisons provided significant financial support to Greybull Capital, including a loan of up to 25 million, to help stabilize the business and facilitate its turnaround. However, the investment proved insufficient to reverse its fortunes in an increasingly competitive market dominated by established players like Tesco Express and Sainsbury's Local, as well as discounters.

The challenges faced by the former Morrisons' M Local stores under Greybull Capitals stewardship were multifaceted. High operating costs, coupled with intense price competition and shifts in consumer shopping habits, created a difficult trading environment. Despite efforts to rebrand and reposition the stores as My Local, aiming for a community-focused offering, the chain failed to gain significant traction or achieve sustainable profitability. The decision to appoint KPMG as administrators came after a period of intense financial pressure, leaving no viable path forward without significant restructuring.

KPMG's immediate priority has been to manage the closure of the 93 unprofitable stores and to seek buyers for the remaining 32. Sources close to the administration process indicate that finding a single buyer for the remaining portfolio might be challenging, suggesting that individual or smaller clusters of stores could be sold off to other retailers or convenience store operators. The closure process will unfortunately result in the loss of a significant number of the 1,658 jobs, though Morrisons' proactive offer to re-employ former My Local staff, where possible, provides some relief to those affected. This gesture by Morrisons highlights its ongoing commitment, having initially established the convenience arm and then divested it.

The collapse of My Local underscores the difficulties even established players face in the convenience sector. For Greybull Capital, this represents a significant setback, adding to their mixed portfolio of investments. The future of the remaining 32 stores hinges entirely on KPMGs ability to secure buyers within a reasonable timeframe, failing which, they too will inevitably shut, marking the complete disappearance of the My Local brand from the high street, less than a year after its high-profile launch under Greybull.

Type_2:
The study tracked more than 200,000 Australian smokers and non - smokers above the age of 45 over six years . Mortality risk went up with cigarette use , BMC Medicine reports . Smoking 10 cigarettes a day doubled the risk , while 20 - a - day smokers were four to five times more likely to die . Although someone who smokes could lead a long life , their habit makes this less likely . Smoking increases the risk of a multitude of health problems, including various cancers, cardiovascular diseases, and respiratory illnesses. The study, published in BMC Medicine, underscored the profound impact of even moderate smoking on mortality rates, reinforcing decades of research on the dangers of tobacco. Lung cancer is perhaps the most well-known consequence, but smoking also significantly elevates the risk of cancers of the throat, mouth, oesophagus, bladder, kidney, pancreas, stomach, and cervix, as well as acute myeloid leukaemia. Beyond cancer, smokers are at a much higher risk of heart attacks, strokes, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), emphysema, and bronchitis. It also contributes to conditions like type 2 diabetes, age-related macular degeneration (leading to blindness), and osteoporosis, weakening bones.

Prof Emily Banks, a leading researcher involved in the BMC Medicine study, emphasised that "Even smoking a few cigarettes a day has substantial effects on mortality." Her work, along with findings from other major health organisations, consistently points to a clear dose-response relationship between cigarette use and adverse health outcomes. Organizations such as Cancer Research UK and the American Cancer Society have long championed public health campaigns to reduce smoking rates, highlighting the preventable nature of many tobacco-related diseases. In the UK, significant progress has been made in reducing smoking prevalence, but it remains a leading cause of premature death and illness. The message from health experts is clear: quitting smoking at any age can dramatically improve health prospects and extend life, reducing the heightened risks associated with continued tobacco use. Even for long-term smokers, quitting starts a process of healing and risk reduction that can add years to one's life and improve overall quality of health. The evidence is overwhelming: every cigarette takes a toll on the body, making the decision to quit one of the most beneficial steps an individual can take for their health and well-being.
Type_5_1st:
A six-year investigation, detailed in BMC Medicine, monitored over 200,000 Australian individuals, both smokers and non-smokers aged 45 and above, revealing that the risk of mortality directly increased with cigarette consumption. Daily smoking of ten cigarettes was found to double this risk, while individuals consuming twenty cigarettes a day faced a four-to-five-fold higher likelihood of premature death. Although a smoker might still experience a long life, their habit significantly diminishes this probability. This research highlighted the profound impact of even moderate smoking on death rates, corroborating decades of evidence on tobacco's dangers, and links smoking to a wide array of health complications, including various forms of cancer, cardiovascular ailments, and respiratory conditions.

While lung cancer is arguably the most recognized consequence, tobacco use also considerably elevates the chances of developing cancers of the throat, mouth, esophagus, bladder, kidney, pancreas, stomach, and cervix, along with acute myeloid leukemia. Beyond cancerous diseases, smokers encounter substantially elevated risks of heart attacks, strokes, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), emphysema, and bronchitis. Smoking also plays a role in the onset of conditions such as type 2 diabetes, age-related macular degeneration (which can lead to blindness), and osteoporosis, which weakens bones.

Professor Emily Banks, a key researcher involved in the BMC Medicine study, emphasized that "Even minimal daily smoking carries substantial mortality consequences." Her findings, consistent with those from other major health organizations, underscore an undeniable dose-response relationship between cigarette intake and adverse health outcomes. Institutions like Cancer Research UK and the American Cancer Society have long championed public health initiatives aimed at lowering smoking rates, stressing the avoidable nature of many tobacco-related illnesses. In the United Kingdom, notable progress has been made in reducing smoking prevalence, yet it remains a leading contributor to early death and disease.

Health experts are unequivocal: ceasing smoking at any point in life can dramatically enhance health prospects and extend lifespan, mitigating the elevated dangers linked to continued tobacco use. Even for long-term smokers, quitting initiates a process of bodily recovery and risk reduction that can add years to one's life and improve overall well-being. The evidence is indisputable: each cigarette inflicts harm on the body, making the decision to quit one of the most beneficial actions an individual can take for their health.

Type_2: The collection of images , along with medals and badges , will go on auction later in July . The find " is like a time capsule that sheds new light on the war " , auctioneer Charles Hanson said . The photos were taken by Robert Oliver , who survived the brutal realities of the Boer War, serving with distinction as a Royal Army Medical Corps sergeant. His collection, meticulously preserved, offers an unparalleled glimpse into the daily lives of soldiers, the harsh landscapes, and the stark realities of conflict that shaped the early 20th century. Among the items is his coveted Queen's Medal for South Africa, complete with multiple clasps, a testament to his bravery and presence in pivotal campaigns, including those in the Orange Free State. This remarkable archive not only documents his personal journey but also provides vital historical context to the operations of the British Empire during a period of immense geopolitical change. Charles Hanson emphasized that such a comprehensive and personal archive is exceedingly rare, offering historians and collectors a unique opportunity to connect directly with the past. Olivers images capture both the grim determination of the troops and unexpected moments of camaraderie and quiet reflection, far removed from the staged photographs often seen from that era. These candid shots, combined with his medals and personal effects, paint a vivid portrait of a man who witnessed history unfold and had the foresight to document it. The sheer depth of the collection, detailing everything from medical tents to troop movements across the veld, makes it an invaluable resource for understanding the human cost and strategic challenges faced by the British forces. It truly is, as Hanson stated, a time capsule, brimming with untold stories and forgotten perspectives that challenge existing narratives of the conflict. The auction is expected to draw international interest due to the rarity and historical significance of Olivers contributions to documenting one of the British Empire's most challenging conflicts.

Type_2: Three incidents have happened near to the Hillhead Halls of Residence between September and November . The man is described as white , aged between 17 and 20 , about 5 ft 8 in tall , with short dark hair, and a slim build. He was seen wearing a dark hooded top and dark trousers in all three incidents. The first incident occurred on the evening of Friday, September 15th, when a female student was approached and followed. The second, on Tuesday, October 3rd, involved a similar approach and an attempted theft. The most recent incident, on Wednesday, November 8th, escalated to an assault, though the victim was not seriously injured. All incidents took place in the vicinity of the Hillhead Halls of Residence, raising significant concern among residents and staff. Det. Constable Kirsty Munro, the investigating officer, stated, "We are taking these incidents very seriously and are increasing patrols in the area around the Hillhead Halls of Residence. We urge anyone with information, no matter how small, to come forward. It is crucial that we identify this individual to prevent further incidents. Residents should remain vigilant and report any suspicious activity immediately to an officer or by calling 101, or anonymously via Crimestoppers.

Type_2:
Data in its first call home since Tuesday 's flyby suggest the spacecraft experienced no upsets as it hurtled past the icy world at 14km / s ( 31,000 mph ) . The signal came through a giant dish in Madrid , Spain - part of a Nasa network of communications antennas . The message took four hours 25 minutes to traverse 4.7 billion km of space . The tension mounted as scientists and engineers at mission headquarters in Laurel , Maryland , waited for telemetry information . So there was joy and relief when the signal was finally confirmed to be robust and filled with precious data. A roar of applause erupted in the mission control room, followed by hugs and back-patting among the weary but elated team members. For years, this moment had been the culmination of relentless effort, meticulous planning, and countless sleepless nights. The successful transmission meant that the spacecraft, after its perilous close encounter, had survived intact and was now sending back the treasure trove of information it had collected.

The first packets of telemetry confirmed the health of all onboard instruments, including the high-resolution cameras, spectrometers, and magnetometers. Scientists immediately began processing the initial raw data, eager for the first glimpses of the mysterious icy world. This successful flyby represents a pivotal moment in our exploration of the outer solar system, pushing the boundaries of what is possible and offering an unprecedented look at a celestial body previously only dimly observed from afar. The data received promises to revolutionize our understanding of cryogenic geology, potential subsurface oceans, and the conditions necessary for habitability beyond Earth.

Mission scientists expect to be sifting through the downloaded information for months, if not years. Each byte of data carries the potential to unlock new secrets about the universe, from the composition of the ice to the potential presence of plumes or geological activity. The incredible journey of the spacecraft, travelling billions of kilometers from Earth, has now yielded its first major reward, validating the ingenuity of the engineers and the dedication of the scientists. This critical 'call home' was not just a technical triumph, but a profound affirmation of humanity's unyielding curiosity and its quest to explore the cosmos. The images and spectral data will provide a wealth of information about the surface features, atmospheric composition (if any), and magnetic field interactions, painting a comprehensive picture of this distant, enigmatic world. The mission team, having overcome the immediate hurdle of the flyby and data transmission, now faces the equally exciting challenge of interpreting what the spacecraft observed and translating those observations into groundbreaking discoveries. This initial success paves the way for deeper analysis and potentially future missions to similar targets, fueled by the insights gained from this remarkable encounter.

Type_2:
On Monday , Mrs May met the first and deputy first ministers on a one - day visit to Northern Ireland . She stressed that no - one wanted a return to the " borders of the past " . Her meeting with Mr Kenny is understood to have focused on the impact of Brexit on British and Irish relations . Earlier in July , shortly after her appointment as the new prime minister , Mrs May spoke to Mr Kenny by telephone and agreed to build on the " strong, existing relationship" between their two countries. Mrs. May reiterated her pledge that there would be no return to the hard borders of the past, emphasizing the deep historical, cultural, and economic ties that bind the UK and Ireland. Her discussions in Belfast and Dublin were aimed at understanding the specific concerns of Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland, as both jurisdictions navigate the unprecedented challenge of Brexit. She acknowledged the unique circumstances of the island of Ireland, where the land border between the UK and the EU would present particular difficulties for trade, freedom of movement, and, crucially, for the delicate peace process established by the Good Friday Agreement.

During her meetings, Mrs. May assured all parties that the UK government was fully committed to protecting the peace agreement in all its dimensions. This commitment, she stressed, included finding practical solutions to the border issue that would respect the integrity of the UK internal market while avoiding any physical infrastructure or checks. She highlighted the need for flexible and imaginative approaches, signalling a willingness to explore innovative customs arrangements and regulatory alignment where necessary to prevent a disruptive outcome for the cross-border economy. The prime minister underscored the importance of ensuring that Northern Irelands unique position was reflected in the ongoing Brexit negotiations with the European Union, making it clear that the needs of Northern Ireland would be a priority for her government.

Mr. Kenny, for his part, conveyed Irelands significant concerns regarding the potential impact of Brexit, particularly the re-emergence of a hard border on the island. He stressed the importance of maintaining the Common Travel Area, protecting the rights of citizens, and safeguarding the integrated all-island economy, which has flourished since the peace agreement. Mr. Kenny reiterated Ireland's desire for a comprehensive and ambitious future relationship between the UK and the EU, one that would minimise disruption and uphold the principles of the Good Friday Agreement. He also emphasised the unique role of the Republic of Ireland as an EU member state, committed to the single market and customs union, yet also bound by its shared history and geography with the UK and Northern Ireland. Both leaders recognised that the challenges posed by Brexit required close cooperation and a pragmatic approach from all sides, including the European Commission and the remaining 27 EU member states.

The discussions also touched upon the broader implications for British-Irish relations beyond the immediate economic and political challenges. Mrs. May and Mr. Kenny committed to maintaining the strong bilateral dialogue and collaboration that has characterised their nations' relationship in recent decades. They agreed on the necessity of ongoing engagement at all levels  political, official, and civil society  to address the complex issues arising from the UKs decision to leave the EU. The shared aim, they concluded, was to forge a new partnership that respects the referendum result while preserving the peace, prosperity, and close ties that have defined the relationship between the UK, Northern Ireland, and the Republic of Ireland, ensuring that the progress achieved since the Good Friday Agreement is not undermined by future arrangements. This joint determination to seek a pragmatic and mutually beneficial outcome underscored the significance of Mrs. May's visit as a crucial early step in shaping the post-Brexit landscape for the island of Ireland and for Anglo-Irish relations.

The two were dragged out of a car by a group of men along a highway between Noida , a Delhi suburb , and Kanpur city on Friday , reports said . Three male relatives travelling with them were assaulted and tied up . The incident has caused outrage across the country and raised serious questions about the safety of women, particularly on national highways in Uttar Pradesh. The horrific crime, which took place near Bulandshahr, has reignited a fierce debate over law and order in the state. Reports in the Hindustan Times detailed how the victims  a mother and her teenage daughter  were dragged out of their vehicle, while their male relatives, including the family patriarch, were tied up and assaulted before the women were reportedly gang-raped by a group of dacoits.

The brutality of the assault, occurring on a stretch of highway linking the bustling Delhi suburb of Noida with Kanpur city, has sent shockwaves through the nation. Political leaders, women's rights activists, and the general public have condemned the incident, demanding swift justice for the victims and stringent action against the perpetrators. Protests have erupted in various cities, with demonstrators expressing their anger and fear, and calling for accountability from the state government. Critics have highlighted the apparent lapse in security, emphasizing the vulnerability of travellers on these often-isolated routes. The Uttar Pradesh Police have launched a massive manhunt, deploying several teams to apprehend the culprits, with senior officials assuring that no stone will be left unturned to bring them to justice. The incident serves as a grim reminder of the persistent challenges in ensuring basic safety for citizens, compelling a re-evaluation of security protocols on the nation's road networks.

Type_2: The spire is part of the International Bomber Command Centre , which will tell the story of more than 55,000 personnel killed in the conflict . Officials said while the damage is minor , it showed great disrespect . It is thought vandals used breeze blocks from the site to try and climb up inside the memorial . More on More on this incident, which has deeply saddened veterans and those involved in preserving the legacy of Bomber Command. The International Bomber Command Centre, located near Lincoln in Lincolnshire, is a poignant tribute to the brave men and women who served during World War Two. It specifically honours the aircrew of Bomber Command who made the ultimate sacrifice, a staggering 55,573 individuals, many of whom were lost over enemy territory. The spire itself, a striking 102ft tall structure, represents the wingspan of a Lancaster bomber and serves as a powerful symbol of their courage and sacrifice. The centre's mission is not only to remember those who died but also to educate future generations about the crucial role Bomber Command played in the conflict and the human cost. This act of vandalism, occurring at a site dedicated to such profound memory and respect, is seen as an insult to the fallen and their families. Local police are investigating the incident, appealing for any witnesses to come forward. The community, along with veterans' groups, has expressed outrage, emphasizing the sanctity of memorials like this which serve as vital reminders of historical sacrifice and the importance of peace. Efforts are underway to repair the minor damage and ensure the security of this important memorial, which continues to draw visitors from across the globe keen to learn about the bravery of the World War Two aircrew.

This striking structure symbolizes the wingspan of a Lancaster bomber and serves as a powerful emblem of the courage and sacrifice displayed by those who served. Beyond merely remembering the fallen, its mission is to educate future generations about Bomber Command's crucial role in the conflict and the profound human cost.

Recently, the memorial suffered an act of vandalism. Although the damage was minor, officials unequivocally described it as a profound act of disrespect. It is thought that the perpetrators used breeze blocks found on site to attempt to climb inside the memorial. This incident has deeply distressed veterans and all those committed to preserving Bomber Command's heritage, widely perceived as a direct insult to the fallen and their families.

Local police are actively investigating the matter and urging any witnesses to come forward. The community, alongside various veterans' organizations, has expressed widespread outrage, stressing the sacred nature of such memorials as vital reminders of historical sacrifice and the pursuit of peace. Work is currently underway to repair the superficial damage and bolster security at this significant site, which continues to attract visitors from across the globe keen to learn about the bravery of World War Two aircrew.

Beyond mere commemoration, its vital mission is to educate future generations about the critical role Bomber Command played in the conflict and the immense human cost.

Recently, the memorial suffered an act of vandalism. Although the physical harm was minor, officials unequivocally condemned it as a significant act of disrespect. Local police are actively investigating and urging any witnesses to come forward. Type_2:
The assaults happened in Castlemilk , Glasgow , at about 20:05 on Friday . Police said the boy was walking in Ardencraig Quadrant near its junction with Ardencraig Drive when he was seriously assaulted . His 52 - year - old father , who saw the incident , was attacked when he ran over to help . The pair were both treated in hospital for facial injuries .

Police have launched a full investigation into the shocking incident and are appealing for witnesses. Detective Inspector Peter McFarlane, who is leading the inquiry, described the attack as "senseless and brutal." He stated, "This was an unprovoked and violent assault on a young boy and his father, who was simply trying to protect him. Both victims have been left shaken by this terrifying ordeal, and it's imperative that we trace those responsible. The facial injuries sustained by both individuals, while not life-threatening, required medical attention and have caused significant distress."

Detective Inspector McFarlane urged anyone who was in the Ardencraig Quadrant or Ardencraig Drive areas of Castlemilk, Glasgow, around the time of the incident to come forward. "We are particularly keen to speak to anyone who may have seen individuals acting suspiciously in the vicinity, or who may have dashcam footage or private CCTV that could assist our investigation," he added. "Even the smallest piece of information could prove vital in piecing together what happened and identifying the culprits. We understand that residents in Castlemilk will be concerned by this news, and I want to reassure the community that extensive enquiries are underway. Officers will be conducting high-visibility patrols in the area to provide reassurance."

Anyone with information is asked to contact Police Scotland via 101, quoting incident number [XXXX] of that date. Alternatively, information can be passed anonymously to Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111. The police are committed to bringing the perpetrators of this despicable crime to justice.

Type_2: He was asked if a change in the law was being considered as part of a review of marriage laws . " Not as far as I 'm aware and I 've certainly no intention of doing so , " he told the BBC . The unnamed government official's remarks came amid a broader review of family legislation. He clarified that the current review, covering England and Wales, primarily focuses on administrative and procedural updates to marriage and divorce processes, not on altering the fundamental definition of marriage itself. He emphasized that any changes would aim to streamline the system, making it more efficient and accessible for citizens, rather than instigating major societal shifts. Separate legal frameworks apply in Scotland and Northern Ireland, he noted, and the current review does not extend to these devolved areas. "Our focus is firmly on practical improvements to the existing law," he reiterated to the BBC, "not on initiating a debate about what marriage is." He further explained that the review seeks to simplify legal requirements, such as those related to wedding venues and notice periods, ensuring they are suitable for modern life. There is no intention to redefine marriage or extend its scope beyond its current legal interpretation. The review process involves extensive consultation with legal experts, religious groups, and other stakeholders across England and Wales to ensure that any proposed amendments are well-considered and reflect public need without undermining the established principles of marriage. He stressed the government's commitment to providing a clear and stable legal framework for all families.

Type_2:
Streets will be pedestrianised , new trees and plants added , and public art and cycle routes installed . A University spokesperson said the work would make the campus more welcoming , safer and greener for everyone to use . The scheme , funded by Sheffield City Region Investment Fund and the University , is due to be completed in phases, with significant enhancements to the iconic Western Bank campus expected to fully transform the public realm by 2025. This ambitious project will not only create a more aesthetically pleasing environment but also significantly improve accessibility and connectivity across the campus, benefiting students, staff, and the wider Sheffield & South Yorkshire community. The pedestrianisation of key streets will reduce traffic, prioritising active travel and creating quiet, contemplative spaces for study and relaxation. New planting schemes will enhance biodiversity and contribute to cleaner air, aligning with the University's commitment to sustainability. Public art installations will add character and inspire creativity, while an extensive network of new and improved cycle routes will encourage eco-friendly commuting and leisure activities.

Keith Lilley, Director of Estates and Facilities at the University of Sheffield, emphasised the transformative potential of the development. He stated, This investment marks a crucial step in our vision for a modern, sustainable, and inclusive campus. The support from the Sheffield City Region Investment Fund has been instrumental in making this aspiration a reality. Our goal is to create a vibrant heart for the University that seamlessly integrates with the surrounding city, offering an exceptional experience for everyone who visits or works here. By prioritising green spaces and active travel, we are not only improving the daily lives of our campus community but also contributing to the health and well-being of the entire region. This scheme will solidify our position as a leading urban university, deeply rooted in the heart of Sheffield & South Yorkshire, committed to creating a better future for its people and environment.

The development forms part of a wider masterplan to rejuvenate the University's estate, ensuring it remains a world-class institution that is environmentally responsible and socially engaged. It represents a significant commitment to enhancing the public realm, promoting sustainable travel, and fostering a stronger sense of community pride within the city. This project will make the Western Bank area a truly exemplary urban campus, setting a new standard for university environments in the UK.

Type_2: Paul Newall , 30 , from Larkhall , died after his Kawasaki bike was in collision with a white Mazda 2 on the M74 northbound carriageway near junction 7, close to Hamilton. The tragic incident occurred on Saturday afternoon, at approximately 1:30 PM, prompting a significant emergency response. Paramedics and police attended the scene, but despite their efforts, Mr Newall, a popular member of the Larkhall community, was pronounced dead at the scene. The road was closed for several hours to allow for a full collision investigation. Police Scotland are now appealing for anyone who witnessed the incident, or who has dashcam footage, to come forward and assist with their inquiries into the circumstances surrounding the fatal crash.

Type_2: Zee Entertainment Enterprises said its entire catalogue of Bollywood films , recorded with Hindi dialogue , would be dubbed into Spanish . The channel , Zee Mundo , is the first attempt to market Indian movies in the Hispanic market . The move comes as Zee Entertainment Enterprises looks to tap into the fast-growing Spanish-speaking audience across the Americas, particularly in key markets like Mexico and the United States. While Bollywood films have a global fan base, language has often been a barrier for wider penetration in non-English or non-Hindi speaking regions. Dubbing the Hindi dialogue into Spanish aims to remove this barrier, making the vibrant storytelling, elaborate musical numbers, and compelling narratives more accessible to a new demographic. Zee Mundo will offer a mix of genres, from action and romance to drama, all tailored for the local sensibility, ensuring a diverse viewing experience for its Hispanic audience. This strategic expansion represents a significant investment by Zee Entertainment Enterprises to diversify its global reach and establish a strong foothold in a previously untapped market.

Stuart Jones should have claimed a late equaliser , but his header from close range flew agonisingly wide of Peter Jehle's post in the dying moments. The home side, having fought back bravely after the early dominance from Vaduz, were left to rue their missed opportunities. Vaduz's first-half superiority, highlighted by the clinical finishes from Gonzalo Zarate and Maurice Brunner, proved decisive. Despite a much improved second-half display from the hosts, spearheaded by Kieran Smith's persistent attacking play, they couldn't find the crucial second goal. Peter Jehle, despite the earlier error, made several crucial saves later on to preserve Vaduz's slender lead. The result meant that Vaduz secured a vital away win, maintaining their strong start to the season and leaving the home side frustrated, knowing they had pushed their opponents all the way after a difficult start. The tactical changes at half-time had clearly galvanised the home team, but ultimately it wasn't enough to overturn the two-goal deficit provided by Zarate and Brunner.

Type_2:
The teenager is charged with supplying drugs in East Calder , where police are investigating the death of 15 - year - old Dione Melville . Emergency services were called to a house in the town on Sunday morning , but the teenager was pronounced dead at the scene shortly after their arrival.

Police Scotland confirmed that a 17-year-old male has been arrested and charged in connection with supplying controlled drugs and is due to appear at Livingston Sheriff Court. The investigation into Diones death is ongoing, with a post-mortem examination scheduled to determine the exact cause.

Dione, a popular pupil at St John's Academy in Livingston, has been widely remembered by friends and family. Tributes have poured in on social media, expressing shock and sadness. A family statement described her as "our beautiful girl, who was loved by everyone." Lisa Grubb, a close family member, posted a heartfelt tribute online, urging young people to be aware of drug dangers.

Chief Inspector Alistair Leitch, Local Area Commander, said: "Our thoughts are with Dione's family. We understand the East Calder community will be deeply affected. A thorough investigation is underway, and we are following several lines of enquiry."

Police appeal for anyone with information to contact Police Scotland via 101, quoting the incident number. The community remains in shock as details unfold.
